intro: Cacalia cancellata, commonly known as the white ragwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy as well. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters that bloom in late summer. Cacalia cancellata is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
